pinyin: lao3 nian2 xing4 chi1 dai1 zheng4

sentences.english: But the onset of dementia invites no ceremony, no grieving.
sentences.chinese: 痴呆症的发作没有预兆，也没有哀悼。

sentences.english: Xiangqin suffers from dementia and insists on looking for Deming.
sentences.chinese: 香琴患上老人痴呆症，坚持要去找德明。

sentences.english: Is it hard to see your friends live with Alzheimer's?
sentences.chinese: 见到朋友们得了老年痴呆症，您不好受吧？

sentences.english: PAUL SEEDHOUSE: "It was actually for communicating with people who suffer from dementia."
sentences.chinese: 那个语音厨房实际上是为了与老年痴呆症患者沟通。

sentences.english: Exercise is also strongly associated with a reduced risk of dementia late in life.
sentences.chinese: 锻炼还可大大降低老年期罹患早发性痴呆症的危险。

sentences.english: More than 140 people developed Alzheimer's disease.
sentences.chinese: 其中140多人患上了早老性痴呆症。

sentences.english: At the moment, 4.5m Americans have Alzheimer's.
sentences.chinese: 现在有4百50万美国人患有痴呆症。

sentences.english: Alzheimer's disease in its early stage may cause amnestic mild cognitive impairment.
sentences.chinese: 老年痴呆症的初期可能会引起轻度的认知障碍。

sentences.english: , director of the Alzheimer’s Disease Research Center at University of Michigan Health System, who conducts research with Sabin and others in her community.
sentences.chinese: 她是密歇根大学健康系统老年痴呆症研究中心的主任。

sentences.english: Blood tests may be able to predict the pace of Alzheimer’s disease progression, according to a new study.
sentences.chinese: 一项新研究表明，血检能预测老年痴呆症的加重速度。

sentences.english: At the beginning, all were free of dementia.
sentences.chinese: 起初，这些人都是没有老年痴呆症的。

sentences.english: Doctors said Tillie probably had Alzheimer's.
sentences.chinese: 医生说，蒂莉可能有老年痴呆症。

sentences.english: High levels of homocysteine have been linked to a greater risk of Alzheimer's.
sentences.chinese: 高浓度的高半胱氨酸会导致患老年痴呆症的风险增加。

sentences.english: The group home for the elderly people with dementia built in the residential section in Noboribetsu City, Hokkaido, JAPAN.
sentences.chinese: 该住宅为老人院痴呆症的人构建，位于日本北海道。

sentences.english: Alzheimer's disease in its early stage may cause amnesic mild cognitive impairment.
sentences.chinese: 老年痴呆症的初期可能会引起轻度的认知障碍。

sentences.english: Suffering from dementia, she had apparently wandered off and gotten lost.
sentences.chinese: 她患有老年痴呆症，很明显是由于擅自出走而走失的。

pinyin: A1 er3 ci2 hai3 mo4 bing4
A1 er3 ci2 hai3 mo4 zheng4
A1 er3 ci2 hai3 mo4 shi4 zheng4

definition: Alois Alzheimer (1864-1915), German psychiatrist and neuropathologist

pinyin: A1 er3 ci2 hai3 mo4 shi4 bing4
lao3 nian2 xing4 chi1 dai1 zheng4
duo1 fa1 xing4 ying4 hua4 zheng4

definition: to suffer (from an illness)/to fall ill
